definition: to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: The road winds through the forest.
Our plane hobbled  through the cloud cluster.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘坐的飛機顛簸着穿過了那塊雲團。

sentences.english: After walking through the fields he had big clumps of soil on his boots.
sentences.chinese: 穿過田野後，他的兩隻靴子滿是泥塊。

sentences.english: Take a walk through the park on Zhongshan Road.
Through the dark robe oft amber rays prevail.
sentences.chinese: 琥珀色光線穿過黑袍而透射。

sentences.english: Haitian woman crosses a street of Port-au-Prince February 1, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 穿過海地太子港街道的婦女。

sentences.english: She has journeyed on horseback through Africa and Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 她騎馬旅行，穿過了非洲和土耳其。

sentences.english: This newly-built road twisted and turned across the hills.
sentences.chinese: 這條新建成的公路蜿蜓曲折地穿過羣山。

sentences.english: We crossed the state boundary at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 我們在午夜穿過了州界。

sentences.english: What can pierce one's ears without a hole.
sentences.chinese: 什麼東西可以不用孔就可以穿過耳朵？

sentences.english: Ben:"Since Mercury10 has crossed paths with Jupiter, your fortunes are falling."
sentences.chinese: 墨丘利神已經穿過木星的軌道，你的運氣正在下落。

sentences.english: They drove a tunnel through the rock.
sentences.chinese: 他們鑿通一條穿過岩石的隧道。

sentences.english: Their conversations straightly pass through my ears.
sentences.chinese: 他們的談話內容直穿過我的耳朵。

sentences.english: While crossing the street, he looked right and left, afraid that he might run into some passing car.
sentences.chinese: 他穿過馬路時，左顧右盼，害怕撞到過路的車子上。

sentences.english: In Topeka , Kansas, it is illegal to drive ones car through a parade.
sentences.chinese: 在堪薩斯州的託皮卡，開車穿過遊行隊伍也是違法的。

sentences.english: The only river goes right through the centre of London, the Serpentine.
sentences.chinese: 唯一一條穿過倫敦中心的河。

definition: to cross over/to transcend/to cover distance/to overcome/to rise above
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
